page.title: 06The Swimley Fete.
page.content: Every year there is a fete on the cricket field.It is called Swimley Fete because it is for the parishes of Swindon and Himley.Mr.Payne is both Vicar of Swindon and Rector of Himley. It is always a very colourful occasion. There is a fancy dress contest.The first prize is a pound.There is a lucky dip and there are pony rides.They sell hot dogs and hamburgers.They also sell balloons.The St.John Ambulance played the drums and then they put some music on.There is a book stall,a food stall and a pancake stall.They sell food and drinks and icecream in the pavillion. There is hoop-la and many other games. It is always very enjoyable.
